alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 9:01PM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 to 12 inches, highest over the mountains and west of the Continental Divide. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 AM Tuesday to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills will be coldest Wednesday night through early Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
